column4: if I update my version of ubuntu to the latest, does it reinstall gnome etc?

and I'm not sure how to get them back
sudo apt-get install gnome-desktop
thanks this seems to be working
you might want this too: sudo apt-get install gdm
or do a fresh installation :)
won't I lose all my files?
you have a separate /home partition?
or is everything in one partition?
from a terminal type df and see if /home and on a separate /dev
no it isn't :(
then yes, a fresh installation would overwrite your files in /home
that's why it's good to have /home on a separate partition
did you install the server version or desktop?

I always do a fresh install vs. upgrading
